channel.title: easyRSC online
channel.description:
so I've read through about 200000 posts about this on here. I've had every problem that others have had and done the "solutions to those problems" and still have no luck.
Problem: I've portforwarded, put my ip in server.java, changed the server to my ip in the client settings, made sure ports match, compiled. but when i send out the distributed client, they cant connect, and neither can I when i try and run it off my own ip.
am I doing something wrong?
edit: I also have no problem running it off local host, that's simple. Its just when i change to my ip and try to run it from there

item.title: easyRSC online
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

hrach123:

:DIf none of thoose ports work, try using the port 5555 or use port 80, Hope I helped…

note that this is rsc section and those ports aren’t used for private servers here. in rs2 maybe, but only a retard would use port 80 for p-s

Read full topic

item.title: easyRSC online
item.dc:creator: @hrach123 hrach123
item.description:
@hrach123 wrote:

:DIf none of thoose ports work, try using the port 5555 or use port 80, Hope I helped…

item.title: easyRSC online
item.dc:creator: @X_Smokethis X Smokethis
item.description:
@X_Smokethis wrote:

[quote=“blown away, post:7, topic:383390”][quote author=adu link=topic=479169.msg3508917#msg3508917 date=1298402568]

yeh i use whatismyip.com
put that in server.java
put it in the settings.ini

Your ip in the server class should be your internal 192.168 ip address.
[/quote]
i’ve got all that straightened out at this point. thanks for the input though, is appreciated…

my only problem is openning port 43594 or 43595. neither will open[/quote]
Try a totally different port then? Does not have to be these 2, Can be any port.

Read full topic

Port 80 is and will ALWAYS be open.

item.title: easyRSC online
item.dc:creator: @blown_away blown away
item.description:
@blown_away wrote:

yeh i use whatismyip.com
put that in server.java
put it in the settings.ini

the ports should be forwarded correctly, hard to find a guide on my router, no1 seems to use it -.-

edit: I’m trying to port forward, but it shows both 43595 and 43594 as closed… idk how to change since i’m supposedly doing it right according to the only guide i could find on my router

edit2: I re-looked at the guide and i was doing 1 thing wrong, but when i corrected, it still wont work for 43595 and 43594. i got 80 open though.

Read full topic

item.title: easyRSC online
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

Are you using your default gateway in the Server class and your IP from ‘http://www.whatismyip.com/’ in the client? Also make sure you have port forwarded correctly? Try: http://www.yougetsignal.com/tools/open-ports/

Read full topic
